top.translation[0].definitions[0].exampl: The book I wanted was at the very top of the pile.
We could just see the white cliff tops in the distance.
The tops of the mountains were still covered with snow.
She could only just see over the tops of their heads.
He was standing at the top of the stairs.
We’ll sit down once we’re at the top.
Write your name at the top of the page.
Stop and wait for us when you get to the top of the slope.
I filled the glass right to the top.
top.translation[0].definitions[1].defini: the flat upper surface of an object
top.translation[0].definitions[1].exampl: a low wooden table with a glass top
Her fingers drummed on the table top.
We walked along the top of the ancient city walls.
She put the papers down on the top of the piano.
top.translation[0].definitions[2].defini: something that you put on or over an object to cover it, protect it, or prevent liquid coming out of it
top.translation[0].definitions[2].exampl: I can’t get the top off the jar.
You’ve left the top off the toothpaste again!
Can you put the top back on the bottle when you’ve finished with it?
Has anyone seen my pen top?
top.translation[0].definitions[3].defini: a piece of clothing that you wear on the upper part of your body
top.translation[0].definitions[3].exampl: She was wearing a stripy knitted top.
a skirt with a matching top
I can’t find my pyjama top.
top.translation[0].definitions[4].defini: the part of a fruit or vegetable where it was attached to the plant, or the leaves of a plant whose root you can eat
top.translation[0].definitions[4].exampl: Cut the tops off the tomatoes.
I’ve found a recipe for beetroot tops.
top.translation[0].definitions[5].defini: the part of the street or of a piece of land that is the furthest away from you
top.translation[0].definitions[5].exampl: I waited at the top of East Street.
top.translation[0].definitions[6].defini: a child’s toy that spins around on its point when you twist it
top.translation[1].definitions[0].defini: nearest to the top of something
top.translation[1].definitions[0].exampl: We have a flat on the top floor of the building.
the top button of his shirt
I managed to scrape off the top layer of paint.
I found the letter in the top drawer of his desk.
top.translation[1].definitions[1].exampl: one of the world’s top engineering companies
top.translation[1].definitions[2].defini: winning in a game or competition
top.translation[1].definitions[2].exampl: Despite losing last night, Manchester United are still top  (=the highest in a list of clubs in a competition).
Barcelona remain top of the league after beating Real Madrid.
top.translation[2].definitions[0].defini: to be higher than a particular amount
top.translation[2].definitions[0].exampl: Their profits have reportedly topped £1,000,000 this year.
top.translation[2].definitions[1].defini: to be in the highest position in a list because you are the most successful
top.translation[2].definitions[1].exampl: The Tower of London tops the list of London’s most popular tourist attractions.
the team that has topped the Premiership for the last three seasons
In 1998 the group topped the charts with the song ‘Don’t Stop Loving Me’.
top.translation[2].definitions[2].defini: if you top something, you do something that is better than it
top.translation[2].definitions[2].exampl: He topped his previous best performance, coming second in the 100 metres.
top.translation[2].definitions[3].defini: if you top a hill, you reach the top of it
top.translation[2].definitions[3].exampl: We topped the hill and looked down towards the valley below us.
top.translation[3].definitions[0].exampl: The top rate of income tax has been cut sharply.
She spent five years in the top job.
He is among the top 5% of earners in this country.
top.translation[3].definitions[1].exampl: the top 100 companies in the UK
top.translation[4].definitions[0].defini: to be higher than a particular amount
top.translation[4].definitions[0].exampl: Profits this year should top £1.2 billion.
Last year bilateral trade topped $1 billion.
top.translation[4].definitions[1].defini: to offer more money than someone else
top.translation[4].definitions[1].exampl: A rival company has topped our offer by $5 million.
top.translation[5].definitions[0].defini: the most important or most successful position in an organization, company, group etc
top.translation[5].definitions[0].exampl: He started life at the bottom and worked his way up to the top.
This decision has come from the top (=was made by the most important managers).
